thread.title: North East news LIVE: Latest breaking news, sport, weather, traffic and travel

author: Sean Seddon
title: North East news LIVE: Latest breaking news, sport, weather, traffic and travel
text:
15:25 Walker fire yesterday
Tyne and Wear Fire and Rescue Service have posted these pictures from inside a factory which caught fire in Walker yesterday. 14:40
Delays near the Tyne Bridge due to broken down car. 14:38 Hate crime in Teesside
Here’s one from Teesside today:
There has been a spike in racist hate crimes on Teesside since the Brexit vote, new figures show.
The latest Home Office data shows an increase in the number hate crimes reported to the police, where race is the motivating factor, during the year of the Brexit vote.
In the 2016-17 financial year, 631 incidents were recorded by Cleveland Police , where someone was abused or attacked due to their race. The EU and Union flags (Image: PA) 14:04
The bike ride in the city centre is still causing congestion. 12:34 Sunderland Airshow
Looking for Sunderland Airshow updates?
We’ve got a dedicated live blog over here and here’s the revised timetable for today below. Sunderland Airshow, Typhoon (Image: newcastle chronicle) 12:31 This afternoon's top story
Here’s the story leading our website now.
A teenager has slammed a Newcastle bar for refusing him entry for being ‘drunk’ - despite explaining he had a disability.
Liam Gaughan and his friend Alex Brown, both 19, tried to get into Jalou, near Newcastle Central Station on Thursday night.
But when the pair arrived they said a bouncer refused to let them in, saying Liam was too drunk.
Liam, of Denton Burn, Newcastle , explained he had a stroke after birth and suffers from left-sided hemiplegia, leaving him with a limp and less movement in his left hand. 11:19 City centre bike ride
There are road closures around Newcastle for the HSBC UK City Ride which has just got under way.
Be advised that it will impact on buses in the city centre. 10:58
